repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
#### vim-patch:0b540c6: runtime(help): add omni completion and 'iskeyword' to filetype plugin

Problem:

- Help tags provide a good way to navigate the Vim documentation, but
  many help documents don't use them effectively. I think one of the
  reasons is that help writers have to look up help tags manually with
  `:help` command, which is not very convenient.
- 'iskeyword' is only set for help buffers opened by `:help` command.
  That means if I'm editing a help file, I cannot jump to tag in same
  file using `Ctrl-]` unless I manually set it, which is annoying.

Solution:

- Add omni completion for Vim help tags.
- Set 'iskeyword' for `ft-help`

closes: vim/vim#17073

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0b540c6f381c63c2d80cc0aaef76b0df008b9f86

Co-authored-by: Phạm Bình An <phambinhanctb2004@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Christian Brabandt <cb@256bit.org>

comment_data.body: This entire section is irrelevant for neovim as we took the simple path and adopted SINGULAR THEY/THEM even before it was woke.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,4 +391,29 @@ highlighting.  So do these:
 You can find the details in $VIMRUNTIME/syntax/help.vim
 
 
+FILETYPE COMPLETION					*ft-help-omni*
+
+To get completion for help tags when writing a tag reference, you can use the
+|i_CTRL-X_CTRL-O| command.
+
+
+GENDER NEUTRAL LANGUAGE

comment_data.body: I think it targets users rather than maintainers?

comment_data.body: I was simply stating we solved this problem _years_ ago. Is there anything unclear here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,4 +391,29 @@ highlighting.  So do these:
 You can find the details in $VIMRUNTIME/syntax/help.vim
 
 
+FILETYPE COMPLETION					*ft-help-omni*
+

comment_data.body: `CTRL-X_CTRL-]` completes tags already, why is this needed?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,4 +391,10 @@ highlighting.  So do these:
 You can find the details in $VIMRUNTIME/syntax/help.vim
 
 
+FILETYPE COMPLETION					*ft-help-omni*
+
+To get completion for help tags when writing a tag reference, you can use the
+|i_CTRL-X_CTRL-O| command.

comment_data.body: It only completes tags from tag file in the same directory as the help file being edited. It doesn't complete, helptags in `$VIMRUNTIME`, for example
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,4 +391,10 @@ highlighting.  So do these:
 You can find the details in $VIMRUNTIME/syntax/help.vim
 
 
+FILETYPE COMPLETION					*ft-help-omni*
+
+To get completion for help tags when writing a tag reference, you can use the
+|i_CTRL-X_CTRL-O| command.

@@ -118,6 +118,7 @@ DIAGNOSTICS
 EDITOR
 
 • |:iput| works like |:put| but adjusts indent.
+• |omnicompletion| in `help` buffer |ft-help-omni|

comment_regular_data.body: Can you move the syntax patches to a separate PR?
Oh, I didn't mean to port the syntax file change but only the help doc (since it can be used with Nvim's Treesitter as well). Ok, I will remove 2 commits
